Review Text: The reception at the medical center is terrible!!! There are not enough attendants to meet demands and those that are available are rude, ironic and do not show the slightest willingness to assist anyone. Twice in a row this month I received terrible service, with delays of more than 1 hour, because the reception cannot handle the demand, the system is a crank and even if you arrive 20/30 minutes in advance, as was my case, I gave up. having to wait for the appointment, as I had another appointment (which was scheduled for 2 hours after the appointment). Furthermore, the doctor's schedule was to see a patient every 20 minutes, but her consultations do not take less than 1 hour with each person, in other words, one disrespect on top of another. I don't recommend it and I won't return to this medical center, unfortunately, it had everything to work well and provide an excellent service, but it is poorly managed.

I went to the hospital because it was recommended and I don't regret it! Thank you all from the bottom of my heart and congratulations on the services provided. I highly recommend it without fear.

Review Text: Bad experience, I went to the gastro because I'm having acute pain in my intestines, I mentioned that I was having allergies and he sent me to the allergy and said it wasn't his responsibility. Then I went to the allergo, she asked for a milk allergy test and immunoglobulin E, then the milk test was negative and the immunoglobulin was high, she said it was bad skin elasticity, and my problem is ALLERGIC. Lazy doctor was TOO LAZY to order more tests to investigate. I'm going to look for opinions outside this hospital because they're all lazy, the gastro didn't even want to help me properly, he was nervous because he said the girls at the reception doubled his schedule, and then he was super rude to me and pushed the problem to the hospital, who pushed it back to he. I don't recommend it to anyone, terrible service, I'm going to do the tests that the gastro doctor politely asked for BECAUSE I INSISTED and I'm going to take the results to a decent doctor.

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I have been fighting with this hospital since June for a knee infiltration procedure, which the agreement claimed was authorized and the hospital was not, in September they said that it was finally listed for them as being authorized and since then I have been trying to schedule the procedure where they say they are checking the patient's schedule. requesting doctor and nothing, I send messages every day and no answers, I asked if I couldn't do it with another doctor, they said I would have to ask the health insurance all over again if I changed doctors, absurd because the authorization from the The insurance is not for a doctor, but for carrying out the procedure! I should have already carried out this procedure in June due to the hospital's internal errors in requesting authorization from the health insurance plan. It took almost 6 months to resolve and now I've been trying to schedule it for 1 month. Soon the guide expires and I lose the procedure! Nobody responds, I'm going to complain procon / ANS/ complain here to see if anyone responds since it has become an absurd negligence!

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Today, 10/10/2024, I admitted my husband Adriano at 10:00 am, he had been fasting since 5:00 am to have an endoscopy at 1:30 pm. As soon as we arrived we waited to go up to the room, when we arrived in the room my husband made all the preparations for the exam, at 2:00 pm I asked the nurse what time he would go up, and she told me that he would go up in 30 minutes. At 4:16 pm my husband was taken for the exam and I remained in the room, the nurse said he would return in 30 minutes. At 6:20 pm Adriano came down, that is, I spent the day at the hospital as an escort, they didn't even take a glass of water to the room, remembering that water is not denied to anyone. I fasted with my husband because I couldn't go down and leave him alone, and after he went for the exam I couldn't either, he would come back quickly. I was only informed that the companion's food would be charged at 7:00 pm when my husband's food would arrive. I already had a headache, my husband did too, I had to struggle to get food and water to arrive. Not even the SUS treats patients like this. Neglect and lack of respect, I even found out from the nurse that my husband was already discharged at 4:00 pm, even though he hadn't even had the exam yet. A horror show. I inform you that I am the owner of the plan, I insist on advertising the terrible service provided for free.Thais T Cruz

Review Text: Good morning,I went to the Villa Lobos unit on 09/04 to carry out some exams, where I received the protocol that my exams would be ready on 09/16, today is 10/08 and two exams are in progress.I have a medical appointment with my gynecologist tomorrow 10/09 and I don't have the results to take, the worst thing is that this doctor takes me almost 2 months on the waiting list to get it.I say in chat the deadline for responding is 36 hours, I call the ombudsman's office the deadline is 5 working days, this is absurd, it's your mistake and I'm the one who pays for it?Extensions 7854, 7855 and 7080 came through, someone called Priscila answered and she didn't even let me finish speaking and I started recording again, terrible service with no quality.I will never go to a consultation for this service again, it is a lack of respect for the patient.

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: We admitted my wife for Plastic Surgery (private modality) where we paid R$15,000 up front (Amount only for the Hospital, apart from the cost of other daily rates if necessary). The Hospital reception initially seemed confused when it came to clarifying doubts, directing the matter to other more experienced attendants. Well, because it was a Private Surgical Procedure (Approx. R$64 thousand reais including the Medical Team) the Nursing Manager was unable to explain or even there was a process (procedure) for transferring the ICU (if necessary) to Hospital 09 July for example (coverage under my insurance plan). In this aspect, it generated an intense and heated discussion among the employees of this establishment (the UTi daily rate in the private sector can reach $40 thousand per day, and I already have an insurance plan) and later with my wife, who was quite nervous, by the way, before to go to the Surgical Center. After 10 hours of Surgery, I returned to the Ok Apartment. Meal requests were different at all times and deliveries took a long time. You order one type of soup, they give you another. They say that a companion is entitled to the meals, then another person who delivers the meal said no. A type of soup was requested 3 times, they delivered the wrong flavor of soup and one of these times they said it was for the companion (look at the discrepancy in information). The room and bathroom were requested to be cleaned several times, but were completely ignored until the date of leaving the hospital. The Physiotherapist was asked to help with mobility after the patient's 10-hour surgery, there was a heated discussion between Nurse Luciana (who was trying to help us) and the Physiotherapist who did not want to assist, refused, as according to her it was not on her agenda . As the wife had 02 Drains (Pelvic in front and Coquis in the back), the Nursing Leader performed assistance and when trying to adjust the Connectors to remove the Liquids, which ended up leaving them poorly fitted and ending up dirtying the entire bed with blood and grease on the Body Strap. that we purchased privately. Unfortunately, it was a TOTAL DISORDER, with the exception of the Nursing Technicians Lucas, Cris and Nurse Luciana who were always very helpful and trying to help at all times (they have no autonomy, no matter how hard they tried). Furthermore, for anyone who intends to undergo Plastic Surgery or any type of Surgery in this Hospital, RUN AWAY, I DO NOT RECOMMEND IT!!!Note01: We live in the interior of SP Capital, we traveled 2 hours and 30 minutes by car (5 hours round trip) to go through all this trouble at the Hospital.Note02: The Medical team (private) did a great job with the Surgical procedure we contracted, including: - Silicone Prosthesis - Face - Double chin - Liposculpture and Abdominoplasty. Post-surgical treatment by the Medical team is being carried out in the Office of the responsible Doctor on Av. Paulista.

Review Text: TODAY I CAME TO TAKE THE PELVIS MRI EXAM AND DR JOAO HENRIQUE VITOR DIDN'T AUTHORIZE THE EXAM TO BE CARRIED OUT, EVEN AFTER MY DOCTOR SENT AN EMAIL WITH AUTHORIZATION AND INSTRUCTION FROM TESLA.THEY ASKED ME FOR THE MANUAL, I SENT IT, THEY ASKED ME FOR THE IMAGE OF THE CARD, I SENT IT.AND EVEN THEN DR JOAO DIDN'T AUTHORIZE IT, BECAUSE HE WANTS THE AUTHORIZATION IN HIS OWN HAND (ARCAIC).I REQUESTED THE NURSING TEXT FOR THE CORRECT TEXT MODEL, AFTER ALL, MY DOCTOR WILL NOT MAKE THE LETTER AS DR JOAO WANTS, IT WILL BE MISSING A COMMA (CONTAINS SARCASM AND INDIGNATION).I WANT TO MAKE IT ON RECORD THAT THIS WAS A COMPLETE LACK OF RESPECT, BECAUSE I HAD TO DO THE INTESTINAL PREPARATION AND DR JOÃO DIDN'T COME TO SPEAK TO ME IN PERSON AND DIDN'T WANT TO TALK TO MY DOCTOR AND NOBODY GUESSED ME ALSO.FINALLY, I LEAVE HERE WITHOUT EVEN A RESCHEDULE MADE.

Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Villa Lobos Hospital and Clinic on Oratorio Street is incredible, but the same does not happen in exams on Lithuania Street!Yesterday my son had an MRI scheduled for 4pm, we arrived at the clinic at 3pm and when opening the form, we were informed that I was 1 hour late, I decided to stay!My son was fasting and we only went in at 6pm, leaving at 8pm!In addition to all this, at no point do they mention that the use of contrast material is mandatory to perform the exam, which my son had to take or he wouldn't take the exam!And to make it even better, my car was parked in a blue zone, where it cannot stay in the same place for more than 2 hours, I was still fined!Reception staff provide terrible service, with stupid and disrespectful jokes between them all the time. It's worth remembering that we have children on site and the topics are often inappropriate!Now the question remains: Would you accept taking our exam when arriving 2 hours late?I hope it helps other people not to go to the place, as the service on Lithuania Street is terrible!

Review Text: The hospital used to be good, today as in many others, many doctors at the beginning of their careers, without experience, without desire, without love for the profession, I went to this hospital with a broken finger 3 times and it was only on the 3rd time that they discovered it, the first time the doctor He didn't even examine my finger and said it was nothing and gave me anti-inflammatory drops and in the prescription he didn't even have the courage to put them, only the second time the doctor immobilized him and thought what the first one did was absurd, the third time they only managed to find the broken bone because they had an MRI, according to the doctor the x-ray was so bad that it was not possible to see the fracture, a horror show in this hospital, In the SUS it was very likely that they would have already been immobilized on the first day, private hospitals are increasingly more at the same level or worse than the SUS unfortunately....

Review Text: I had to go to the hospital twice to have the procedure done, because the first time the documentation was wrong and the surgery had to be cancelled. Another thing that I didn't agree with is that the hospital does not provide food for the companion. If the companion is unable to do so, he or she will become hungry. But contrary to these denials, the hospital is very clean, the food is very good, the room is organized and the staff welcomed me with great politeness and cordiality.

Review Text: I've been fasting since 6 am at the hospital to undergo a surgical procedure at 8 am. At the exact moment I write, it's 8:30 am and I'm at reception and they haven't called me up yet. I keep thinking: what's the point of arriving two hours early, opening the form and doing everything correctly if the hospital is so slow that it will delay your life anyway?It's no wonder that the hospital has a bad rating, if you have other options, avoid this hospital.

Review Text: I scheduled two exams, an ultrasound with Doppler and a biofetal profile at 7am on 06/08. The doctor only arrived at 7:40 am and I'm 37 weeks pregnant, and I faced all the disorganization of not even knowing how to launch the Biofetal Profile exam in the system.I was seen 45 minutes late and lay down on the stretcher and the doctor, at the end of the ultrasound, said that the exam would be incomplete as there was no cardiotoco to finalize the biofetal profile, and I asked why they didn't tell me at reception. The doctor said that they never know anything, that I should have gone to a maternity unit. Absurd and they even suggested I go to an emergency room.And he said it was a mistake on the part of the hospital center to have scheduled it.Anyway, on the stretcher doing the ultrasound that I was informed about, a huge absurdity, since the beginning of the service.

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: On 03/27/2024 I was admitted to Villa Lobos Hospital, at around 10:11 pm, with the password V874. My first problem started at reception, which took virtually 1 hour to open my file - the file was actually opened at around 11:00 pm.After opening the form and going through the screening process, in which I was treated very well, I went to the office to be seen by the first doctor. I told the doctor in question about the problem I was experiencing, and she showed no interest during the treatment - I would even say a certain irritability. I told the doctor that I had a case of sinusitis at the beginning of the month and, in the same Vila Lobos emergency room, I was seen and treated correctly (antibiotics and other medications): even after the treatment, some symptoms did not disappear and, in As a result, I sought out the service in question.The doctor didn't even get up from her chair to examine my nose, face and throat, listen to my lungs with a stethoscope or show any interest in what I said: on the contrary, as soon as I mentioned my problem, she already made diagnoses using technical terms that, for a person who Looking for an emergency room with a headache and other symptoms, it was extremely scary. When talking about the headache she was feeling to the doctor, she used technical terms to ask the exact location of the pain: medicine needs to be more humanized, as does language, especially in emergency care. Furthermore, he repeatedly said to look for an ENT, showing that he had no interest in better understanding what was happening to me. After the quick - really - interaction with the doctor, she gave me medications to be consumed in the unit itself, blood tests and a CT scan.Regarding the medications I took intravenously, as well as the blood test, I PRAISE the nursing staff, who were kind, cordial and patient during all the procedures. They were the only employees who treated me with empathy and respect.After finishing the medications (around 1:20 am on the morning of March 28), I went to the tomography department, where I was promptly attended to. The other problem happened next: the tomography result/report came out after TWO AND A HALF HOURS of waiting: I asked reception at various times for some opinion, some prediction, and the answers were always evasive and short, as if they hadn't no interest in helping. After my wife went directly to the tomography room, at almost 4:00 am on 03/28, the responsible department said that they had already released the results a long time ago, blaming the reception department for what happened (who can I believe?).After all this, the doctor who provided the initial care left (probably her shift was over) and, unfortunately, I managed to receive even worse care from the second doctor: she was clearly willing to dismiss me from her office as quickly as possible, which was barely commented on. exam results. He said that I no longer had a bacterial sinus infection, according to the blood test and, according to the results of the tomography, he simply told me to see an ENT. I asked what I could do to alleviate the symptoms I was experiencing (a lot, a lot of thick secretion that was constantly coughing up through the nose, which, I believe, was causing the headache I was feeling, as I was straining a lot to try to expectorate it) , and she prescribed simply washing the nose with saline solution and using budesonide (she didn't even print a prescription). Regarding the results of the tomography, I said that I was scared, since it said that I had a deviated septum, since I had the operation in the middle of last year - I asked her if there was a possibility that the deviated septum had returned so quickly and she replied, in a mocking tone "How should I know, I didn't perform your surgery". This entire intervention lasted no more than two minutes, making the ill will of the professional in question clear.

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Dear managers,I would like to express my deep dissatisfaction with the experience I experienced when arriving at the hospital for a surgical procedure. I arrived at 5am as directed, only to discover that there was no bed available to accommodate me.Furthermore, I was informed that my health insurance plan would be charged a daily rate, even though I had not been accommodated in a suitable bed. I was forced to wait at reception until moments before carrying out the procedure, which demonstrates a total lack of consideration and empathy for the patient.This experience made it clear that the hospital lacks the organization and capacity to deal with the basic needs of patients. Not only that, but the care provided was extremely precarious, not in line with the minimum standards expected in a healthcare institution.I honestly cannot recommend this hospital to anyone, and I hope steps are taken to improve reception and patient care in the future.

Review Text: My daughter arrived at the PS ON 03/06 with symptoms of dengue and was sent for testing. The doctor reported that the test was negative. We returned to the PS on 03/09, as the symptoms worsened. When we were seen, the test she had taken days before had come back positive. Conclusion: the doctor at the first appointment changed the tests and said that my daughter did not have dengue, when in reality she had the disease. Now she has been hospitalized for 4 days treating the illness that worsened during these several days of incorrect diagnosis.  Completely irresponsible doctor.

Review Text: Every day gets worse, rede d’or exploits every last drop of each employee. Today, for example, I'm at reception with about 60 people, and there's only one employee to serve everyone. Review Text: Yesterday, 02/22/24, we went to the hospital's emergency room and after seeing the doctor, who prescribed intravenous medication, the service did not happen. There was an incident at the hospital and there was simply one nurse left to care for all the patients in the emergency room. This is unbelievable, how can a hospital leave the emergency room with 1 nurse. Terrible management, which does not hire employees, does not relocate from other floors. Bad, bad and bad, we went home without medication. I've been to a public hospital and I've never seen just 1 nurse in the emergency room. I will never go to that hospital again. I don't even complain about the nurse, he was a survivor in that place. Everyone who is sick wants to be treated and only him. This is a hospital MANAGEMENT problem. Doctors shouldn't even prescribe intravenous medication if they don't have employees. It would have been better to send someone to another hospital. Anyway, the MANAGEMENT of the hospital is terrible. Even the head nurse wasn't there, it was just the technician. If someone had a cardiorespiratory arrest, I think those who would help would be the companions. I have never seen such bad management from a private hospital.

Review Text: I WAS IN THE ADULT EMERGENCY ROOM AT VILLA LOBOS HOSPITAL WITH RESPIRATORY SYMPTOMS ON 02/21/24 AT AROUND 10PM. I WAS PRESCRIBED INTENDED MEDICATION AND FROM WHAT I OBSERVED THE NURSING TECHNICIAN (A BOY), DOES NOT CHANGE GLOVES FROM ONE PATIENT TO ANOTHER, MUCH LESS WASHES HIS HANDS. HE TOOK ACCESS AND KEPT ON THE SAME GLOVE TO MEDICATE ANOTHER PATIENT. I STAYED OVER THE MEDICATION FOR AT LEAST 40 MINUTES AND IN THAT TIME THERE WAS NO CHANGE OF GLOVES AT ANY TIME, MUCH LESS THE USE OF ALCOHOL GEL. FOR A REDE D’OR HOSPITAL, THIS IS AN ABSURD TECHNICAL FAILURE, CROSS INFECTION IS WHAT THE MOST SHOULD HAVE. IS THERE NO CCIH TO OVERSEE THIS? I DIDN'T EVEN WANT TO GET THE TECHNICIAN'S NAME SO AS TO NOT HARMFUL HIM IN REGARD TO THE JOB, BUT I'M DISGUSTED BY THE REASON. I AM A GYNECOLOGIST AND OBSTETRICIAN AND I HAVE A KNOWLEDGE ABOUT INFECTION PREVENTION AND YOU ARE DOING IT VERY WRONG.

Review Text: 2 days ago, I had the IUD inserted in this hospital and I have nothing but praise. I arrived at 11:30 am for the procedure that was scheduled to start at 1 pm, I was in a room waiting until 4 pm, there was a huge delay but this did not make my experience negative as the nurses came to assist me every 30 minutes. Communicative, friendly and super polite nurses, from reception until the moment I left the hospital, where I was taken to the car by the nurse who stayed with me the entire time. What impeccable service, I felt very well looked after. Dr Vânia Regina de Oliveira is a wonderful gynecologist! It was the best care I've ever had, a clean hospital, polite, helpful professionals... I'll definitely consider going back if I need to in the future. Thank you very much!

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I had an appointment for my mother,82 years old, scheduled on 11/21/2023, 2pm, with nephro Carolina Barone. It was a return visit and there were changes to the exams requested. When I got there, they sent me to the wrong floor. When I was called to register, they informed me that it was on the 8th floor, right before the appointment time. My luck is that there are people who work with love for patients and an attendant, surnamed Honório, on that floor, kindly offered to take us inside the hospital, so that we wouldn't miss our appointment.  Arriving on the 8th floor, it was a desert, there was no one.  Miss Honório discovered that the doctor had canceled all afternoon appointments. I understand that the doctor has problems, because we are all human, now, not being warned and leaving far away with an 82-year-old lady, in an UBER, in traffic, and missing the trip because no one from the hospital warned us is a huge disrespect.  Being sent to the wrong floor, too! Now Miss. surnamed Honório, deserves all my praise and thanks. Seeing my concern about a bacteria found in my mother's urine test, he spared no effort and got us an appointment with a General Practitioner, who saw us about an hour later. All my complaints to an administration that fails to notify patients about canceled appointments, all my appreciation to Ms. Honorio who does his work with love and dedication.  A huge compliment to this employee! People like this the world needs! (I forgot her first name, but her last name is Honório!) My eternal gratitude to this being of light!!!!

Review Text: Completely disorganized. Only 3 patients in the ER since 1 am, and it still takes more than 4 hours between care, medication, exam and return. Review Text: I had surgery on 07/09 for endometriosis in this hospital on 09/09, I came back with pain, they medicated me and released me. On 09/11 I came back and had to stay in ICU and then went to the semi. I was discharged on 09/14. However, on the 11th, tests were carried out and showed 2 types of bacteria in the urine. In the end, I returned to the PS, I have just had surgery here and was in pain to stop taking medication, because they didn't want to put me in the Observation area, as the doctor himself told me to be there because of the surgery and the risk of infection.They simply left me here in mediation with pain in the armchair, I ask if I can organize observation, one throws at the other, it's difficult for me to be less than 10 days after exposed surgery with several people here in the PS at risk of SEPSIS, one throws at the other I'm here in the slumped armchair. Now that it's the 3rd time I've been back to the hospital

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Goodnight. I was discharged yesterday from Villa Lobos Hospital. I was admitted to the ICU for 3 days with a diagnosis of tracheobronchitis. To begin with, I want to praise the hospital for its very good and comfortable infrastructure. The service at the PS was also very good. I felt welcomed in the ICU too, however, there was specifically one issue that bothered me and I wouldn't want other people to go through the same situation. Even though I have always warned, and for all time, that my veins are difficult to access because they are very deep and thin, that they burst and do not hold a catheter, the laboratory had to pierce me more than once, causing pain and bruising. But so far so good. The biggest problem occurred later, when the antibiotic Klaricid was administered intravenously, so that for 03 hours, the medicine ripped my vein from the inside, and made me feel immense pain. I really suffered a lot. I even believe that I must be hypersensitive to the medicine. However, this situation was not handled well by the ICU nursing team. A first mistake was not knowing that the aforementioned antibiotic already has a reputation for being quite painful and knowing my difficulty with the vein, they could have at least checked with the doctor on duty whether it could have been administered orally. A second mistake was ignoring my warnings about the difficulties in locating the veins and even so calling another technique to try again to pierce my other arm, twice, without success. The third mistake was that, even after having finished administering the medication into the vein, I was surprised by another nurse while I was sleeping to pierce close to my access in order to find another vein for the next injection of the medication. That's when I almost woke up scared and clarified that the problem wasn't with my access and I didn't want to lose it. Finally, the next day, with the glory of God, I was informed that the medication would be administered orally. I sincerely regret that I had to go through all this and I ask that the hospital better guide its employees regarding the specificity of this medication, and not ignore the patient's information and pain. Other than that, everything was great. Thanks.

The call dropped when I spoke to the answering machine, and when someone answered and I informed them that the call was dropped, sometimes they transferred me without me even finishing my sentence, and then it dropped again. After a lot of trying, I succeeded, but only through a transfer from an attendant.The facilities are very ugly, the hospital looks old and old, but it has been well made up by the network to look elegant.I wouldn't recommend it.

Review Text: I don't know if it's a pattern of this rede d'or or it's still a transition, but you arrive at the hospital with an appointment to be admitted, with luggage, then you and your companion go to a room that isn't actually the room, it's a pre-operative. When the team comes to pick you up to go to the surgery center, your companion is forced to return to reception (with all their luggage) and wait for a place in a room. It can be funny in São Luiz, but that's it. If you are going to have surgery, don't take a companion, wait until they take you to the room, post surgery, then you call them to come visit you.

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP

Review Text: I have been to the hospital for elective consultations with specialists several times. The first service at reception is very quick, the environment is welcoming, clean and organized. In the specialties I underwent (clinical and gastro) there was a delay of up to 1 and a half hours, but despite this, the service from all the doctors was excellent! They do not respond in a hurry, they take the patient's anamnesis and examine them. I once went to the gynecologist with tests ready just for evaluation and even so, she did a gynecological exam during the consultation, which I thought was very good due to her concern (Dr.Barbara). With the clinician (Dr.Bruno) very helpful, I requested, listened to my complaints, examined me and carried out a series of UP check exams. The gastroenterologist (Dr. Thamie) attended without rushing, asked a lot of questions, and was extremely careful.Don't rush to be seen because they take a while but they serve you very well. That's my opinion! Rating 10 for the team!

Review Text: My husband was admitted on 5/28 with 2nd degree burns. From our arrival at the hospital, going to the ICU, transferring to the semi-intensive care unit until discharge, we were very well treated and informed about all the procedures. Dr. Lecy Cabral and team conducted all procedures in a very safe and clear manner. The entire team of nurses, assistants and nursing technicians, without exception, treated us with great respect, care and affection. Thank God my husband returned home after 17 days, but he has already returned to the outpatient clinic twice to change the dressing with Dr. Lecy and Raílda, his nurse, who maintained all the standard of care we had during hospitalization and monitored the evolution of the frame very carefully. We are very satisfied and confident of his speedy recovery thanks to the care he received.

Review Text: I would like to thank you for the procedure carried out on me today at Rede Dor HSL Villa lobos Mooca!!!Dr Douglas Rocha Russo for being so human and patient, definitely the right choice was to hand over my health and quality of life into your good hands!!!Nursing technicians Luciana, Andreza, Vinícius, Odair and Lucas, for all their helpfulness, care, attention towards me and availability to serve!Nurse C Surgical Ana for admitting me for surgery and being so kind!To the top of the top anesthetists, Fabiane and Karen, I have never seen anything similar in my life... Review Text: I used the hospital for 2 surgeries within a period of 10 months... I was very well looked after by the hospital's clinical staff, from the reception to the attentive staff, the nursing team were very polite and strictly followed all patient checking protocols (I'm a nurse) , well-equipped surgical center, in short... everything you would expect from hospital care, I really liked it, and I recommend it.

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: My experience at this Hospital was not very good this last time.  I was admitted to the PS, Saturday at 11 pm, with dehydration due to severe diarrhea and vomiting. The doctor who attended to me sent me to the outpatient clinic where I took a drip with medication, which was good for me because I arrived very dehydrated and with low blood pressure. During the re-evaluation, which took place at almost 1 am, he asked me for a blood count and said the results would come out in 20 minutes, he was lying, it took 1:30 am, the test was already approved for the doctor, but he took another 40 minutes to give me answer because my husband went to complain. My blood count was ok, but even so, due to my blood pressure, he thought it would be better for me to stay for monitoring in the ICU on the 5th floor. I went up to the ICU at around 4:30 am. My plan was for an apartment and I was placed in an ICU with another 15 beds. Regarding the care provided by the nurses and nursing technicians, I was well attended to, but I have some complaints, the diet, besides being terrible, was not suitable for my condition, they had two bathrooms. for purging and two for baths with shower, but they were used by men and women, this is unacceptable, at least they should separate one for men and one for women. During my hospitalization, I didn't even receive a hygiene kit and the bathroom lacked soap to even wash my hands, there was only alcohol gel. The professionals were very attentive but I thought they talked too loudly as if they were at home, including the doctor in charge, a lack of respect for the patient. Not to mention that the PS doctor said I would stay between 12 and 24 hours, another big lie, even though 12 hours later I was fine, they held me until the next day so I could be discharged, I actually was discharged from the ICU at 10:00: 30 am on Monday, when the doctor came by, then I waited for space for me to go to the room and there I would only be discharged home on Tuesday after 10 am, when the doctor would come by again. After 8 hours of waiting for a room, very irritated I called the head nurse to ask her to sign a waiver of further care, which was not necessary, and left. It was unnecessary to spend 39 hours in a hospital if I was already great in the first 12 hours. As for me having a plan that gave me the right to a room with monitoring and it wasn't offered to me because maybe they didn't have one, they should have informed me, which they didn't. Big mistake that won't happen again with me, because I will never do it again.

Review Text: I am now in the PS being very well attended to by everyone, but as with every rule there are exceptions, unfortunately it was no different for the Tomography service provider today, Tainá, with a lot of antipathy towards caring for patients, little education and no sensitivity and attention to others.Other than that, I have great references from this place as I am always treated very well.

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: On the 15/5 I had an appointment with clinician Dr Bruno Topis, when I went to the appointment I asked for a complete checkup and commented that sometimes I felt short of breath, especially when I lay down, the doctor listened to me, ordered all the medical examinations and sent me to the ER so that I could check more quickly about shortness of breath.As I was already in the hospital, I ended up going to the ER and, in addition to the shortness of breath, I said that I had a headache, and that I swore it was sinusitis, I mentioned it again to Dr Luis about the shortness of breath, but I focused my complaint on the headache, in a super attentive and thorough way, the Dr asked me for some tests and then it was detected that I had a mass in the mediatisum, Dr Luis suggested that I stay hospitalized so that I would have more flexibility in carrying out tests and investigation. Finally, a possible Hodgkin's lymphoma was diagnosed, we are still waiting for the results of some tests.I would like to thank all the doctors who attended to me, in addition to Dr Bruno, who in a clinical consultation managed to feel that there was something different even when there was no interference during auscultation, Dr Luis, who even though he was a PS doctor and needed to give me such delicate news was human, respectful, attentive and careful, the hematologist Dr Wellington, who was also super careful and delicate when speaking to me after hospitalization and the MRI report, the nursing team and technicians/assistants, especially Helena who all the days who accompanied me was so cute and gave me the pleasure of knowing her story, which is beautiful by the way, the nurse Grete who accompanied me on the first night, which is always the most difficult and scary, Drs Barbara and Dayana who performed the procedure of my biopsy, who saw me so nervous but they were so human, to nurse Marcos, who knows that everyone who arrives there to do exams is super tense and tries to bring joy and lightness to us, the girls who help with cleaning, the nutritionists and other people in the cup, anyway, I want to thank all of you very much, in addition to thanking God, for having placed so many wonderful and human people in my path.Thank you from the bottom of my heart to all of you, without a doubt this affection and care is what makes the difference in our hospital stays, which are often unexpected and frightening.Congratulations to the entire team and once again I am immensely grateful to Dr Bruno Topis for all his care for me and my family.May God bless each one of you and your families

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP

Review Text: I was admitted to the 4th ICU with a heart attack, where I had a stent inserted. I was treated very well, from urodynamics to the night and afternoon team of technicians, who I don't know if I can name, my guardian angels will know by their initials: L., S .,C, J among others. Physiotherapy: C.Wonderful nutritionists.Nursing: F., and ,M.Kitchen and food ok.. medication ok,Very committed, intelligent, professional and more human cardiologists than I have seen in other hospitals.All of this helped a lot in my recovery there.Gratitude 🙏 to everyone.I went down to the second floor where it was a reality check. It's not similar at all. Anyway, I don't have to complain.Try to keep people who enjoy what they do and wear the company's shirt. I hope the hospital continues like this.,

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I am currently in the Villa Lobos ICU for treatment of a facial infection. The doctor told me that ICU would be necessary in the first 24 hours before I could take intravenous antibiotics.Well, I went in on Tuesday night and should have gone to the room on Wednesday night.Today is Friday and there is no room available. I've been discharged since yesterday and the doctor said she can't release me because I'm in the ICU. And how long will I have to wait for a room before I can go home? Why am I not transferred to the infirmary so I can be discharged?I'm in an environment where I can get a hospital infection without needing to be in the ICU.I haven't been able to sleep for three days because of so much worry and the extreme noise from the ICU.I've had access to my arm without using it for two days.I'm starting to think that they no longer had room to treat me and they put me in the ICU so as not to lose the "customer".Now I am forced to spend more days in the ICU.I feel like a prisoner...

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: Great reception service. Everything fast. Terrible service from the doctor Dr Bruno Topis, clinician. I arrived at around 3:45 pm at the Vila lobos unit, reception everything was ok, I was at the reception waiting for the appointment at which my appointment was at 4:30 pm, there were two patients in front of me and it was already 5:00 pm and they had not been attended to (by logically their consultation was delayed). A girl went to the reception to complain, the doctor left the room, there was no one with him, he saw this girl in two minutes, a boy came in and stayed for 5 minutes, and he didn't see me, another 20 minutes passed, and the doctor was left with no one in the room. I went to reception and complained, after a few seconds he called me. A suggestive service, he thinks it was......, He didn't even give me medication for the pain. Finally, the doctor stays in the room on his cell phone or sleeping, instead of speeding up care.My husband was the next to be seen by the same doctor, the doctor closed the room and left typing on his cell phone, and left us waiting once again, we went to reception and asked to cancel the appointment.Besides, Dr. Iara otorhinolaryngology also does the same thing, my husband went to see her before, she has no patient in the room and doesn't call those who are waiting.Total disregard.We are paying nothing is free.

Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I can confirm that complaining is worth it.It is through criticism and complaints that we learn to improve and I can assure you that the hospital team is CONGRATULATIONS!!!What a change!From the service to my departure yesterday after being hospitalized for 5 days.I live in Mooca and I frequently go to this hospital because unfortunately I have complicated health due to my autoimmune disease.Since the acquisition by RedeDo'r, as well as all mergers between companies, everything takes time to adapt. Training, equipment, etc, etc, etc. I've had several problems with Villa Lobos in the last 2 years, but we ALL need to know how to recognize and also know how to praise when what was already pointed out by you simply changes!This time, upon arrival, in the middle of Hallelujah Saturday (a holiday where we already expect the unwillingness of some employees to be working while they could be at home with their families) the security guard was concerned about generating a password; the cordiality of the attendant who was opening the patients' files; the friendliness of the nursing team at the PS at 5pm on a Saturday; the doctors and even my hospitalization was spectacular.- The room was very clean (in better condition than the last one I had stayed in);- the surgical center (I used it 45 days ago too) with brand new equipment (I'm in the healthcare field, I've been working with medical and imaging equipment for 30 years);- the hospital food (my diet was bland) was delicious. Guys, praising hospital food these days is RARITY!- the concern of nursing technicians Vitor, Lucas, Jaque, etc... nurse VERA, including Dr Caio, who even questioned him about the management of my case, because of my pain, they treated me with the utmost cordiality, affection and demonstrated readiness to resolve the problem.Anyway, when it comes to criticizing, most people know how to do it. But most people don't send compliments because they think it's a waste of time to write.The truth has to be told and we have to recognize that changes have happened and as a resident of Mooca, I feel flattered to have a great location 2 blocks from my apartment.Thank you to the entire team at Villa Lobos Hospital for the welcome and the new restructuring!Congratulations on the change!

Review Text: Terrible service!!In January I scheduled an appointment but I didn't show up, and even after five days they asked for authorization for the procedure and I didn't show up.On March 2nd, I went to another unit to perform the same exam and it turns out that my insurance company denied it, stating that I had already done the exam at Vila Lobos, surprisingly because I didn't do the CT scan there. I contacted the hospital asking them to cancel this authorization to take the exam at the other unit. However, they told us to wait five days to cancel this authorization (I wasted my time going to take the exam in addition to the gasoline).I received a response from the ombudsman this week informing me that the procedure was canceled (ouv680460) and I rescheduled at another hospital to carry out the exam today on 03/08/2023 and to my surprise, my insurance company denied the procedure due to this January authorization.What nonsense and lack of commitment to the consumer, I need to take this exam and I can't do it because of this hospital.

Review Text: Terrible cleaning conditions, blood on the reception benches, infected and piercing material in the room's common trash, a patient in the same room was bleeding and the blood was in common parts of the room such as the bathroom and floor without adequate and constant cleaning. I was fasting for more than 16 hours (medical recommendation was 8 hours), even when I returned from the Surgical Center, food was recommended and requested. Dealer Name: Hospital Villa-Lobos: Emergência Adulto, Cardiológica e Ortopédica São Paulo SP
Dealer Location: R. Lituânia, 260 - Mooca, São Paulo - SP, Brazil
Review Text: I arrived at the emergency room with an unbearable migraine almost to the point of passing out from the pain, I notified the attendants about my pain, who asked me to get the password and wait to be called, I notified the triage nurse about the immense pain I was going through and Once again I was notified that it was my turn to be called! Outraged because I was in pain, I asked them to call a doctor or a nurse. Nurse Cristiano came, super rude, to tell me that the hospital follows criteria! What criteria would those be! But what criteria are those? Waiting for something more serious? To faint ? To be attended to promptly?  Being in the nursing field, I know that every emergency room has an obligation to pass on people with fever and intense pain, and if I wasn't really in such severe pain I would wait, however, in the same place as me, there was a woman suffering from renal colic for more than 1:30 hours. How much neglect. You pay a lot in insurance, and in a moment of pain you seek hospital help, only to be treated poorly and poorly attended to! Thank God there were more humane employees at venipuncture time and medication time! I intend to look for another hospital next time!

Review Text: I'm already a customer and not a patient thereAnyway, I have kidney problems, seizures, diabetes and major cervical neurologist surgery c1 ac7I'm going to the hospital almost daily to take analgesia, which for the disease I have palliatives forI can't touch opioidsBecause I was dependentAs my disease progressive and progressing Degenerative Cervical Myelopathy, I am going there a lotI like it but I'm totally dissatisfied and sadOutpatient step with several doctorsNephro-endocrinologist, cardio-urologist, among othersExams I take thereAnyway, I can't avoid taking opioids because I'll fall back into addiction.These times of going there since December until today I take medicines with an orthopedist and general practitionerHowever, I have epilepsy, a strange kidney because I had kidney failure, hypoglycemia, among others.1 year and a half ago I even denied tramalBut today I suggest I go to the pain clinic where the group of doctors would study my case because I have a dossier there of everything to try to find a solution.In short, they didn't want to admit me to the pain clinic, which is what I got andIf my kidney stops, epilepsy, etc. they admit it, does it have to be something bad to admit it!? I may not have a chance, right?More than 10 surgeries with you, several p.s, several ICUs, several laboratories that I do, all tied up in the system, they prefer that I keep going through the p.sI haven't taken bad opioids for 1 year and a half because it makes me addictive.Jaja, I'm going to stay in the loop until I take morphine, where I'm admitted to a drug addiction clinic to stop.They didn't want to admit me and I took TramalTomorrow I'm asking for morphine all dayThere is a bench to look at my situation, they know about the case and would prefer that a body be stopped to admit me.Neglect, right, and today after a struggle to take opioids I tookI'm not even a patient, I'm already a customerOrthopedist yesterday and clinician made light of it if my password was 2014 physically disabledTake my measurements, okay, I won't step there againNeglect to stop the organ and return to morphine addictionRoberto Silvani pineCPF*******And just pull the gold mine you lost into your systemBut I will call my lawyer and go to another hospital if I don't turn the key to the tramal medicine I tookUgly thing huhWaiting for me to die one day at the door to be hospitalized and I started again with this drug that I once fought to get rid ofI was admitted years ago to the pain clinic so that together I could studyRegrettableBut I'll keep going
